oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Agricultural Reports
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Agriculture; Petroleum industry; Wheat; Grasses; Sheep
Agriculture; Petroleum; Sheep; Grasses
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hard-bound book containing statistical information on Tennessee pertaining to oil regions, sheep husbandry, wheat, and grasses. The appendix has an interesting schedule of questions/answers involving over one hundred correspondents responding to questions about pasture grasses. The names of the correspondents and their post offices are listed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Killebrew, J. B. (Joseph Buckner), 1831-1906
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Joseph Buckner Killebrew (1831-1906) was the first Commissioner of Agriculture in Tennessee, a position he held from 1875-1880. Killebrew is noted for his advocacy on New South principles that included the development of natural resources for industrialization and the improvement of agriculture.
